DOC.detailed_description: Purpose study : evaluation Allium ampeloprasum Spp.Iranicum cream efficacy management hemorrhoid study design : Double blind randomized placebo-control trial , uni-central Study population : Participants symptomatic hemorrhoid attend Shiraz University Medical Sciences clinic Inclusion criterion : Patients symptomatic hemorrhoid ( GRADE 1-4 ) without need emergency operation accord physical examination Exclusion criterion : Participants anal fissure inflammatory bowel disease history gastrointestinal cancer Sample size : 75 patient ( tree group ) Interventions : Topical Allium ampeloprasum cream/ placebo cream/anti-hemorrhoid cream Time period : 3 week Outcome measure : pain , itching , bleeding , defecate discomfort , total improvement , constipation
DOC.criteria: Inclusion Criteria Participants symptomatic hemorrhoid ( GRADE 14 ) without need emergency operation accord physical examination Participants use drug study drug control drug treat hemorrhoid study period : Participants anal fissure inflammatory bowel disease history gastrointestinal cancer Participants hypersensitive predisposition hypersensitive Allium ampeloprasum history skin hypersensivity Female participant pregnancy breastfeed period Participants complicate serious cardio cerebro vascular disease , hepatic renal disease , diseases hemopoietic system neurologic disorder ascitis g history steroid anticoagulant drug consumption
